result.rationale: This species is listed as Vulnerable, in view of its extent of occurrence (EOO) of 14,267 km<sup>2</sup> and area of occupancy (AOO) of 40 km<sup>2</sup>, its occurrence in six threat-based locations, and a continuing decline in the extent and quality of its habitat related to urbanization and agriculture.
result.geographicrange: This species occurs in the central Venezuelan Andes, in tributary streams and creeks of Santo Domingo River, the rivers Saguaz, Río Claro, Boconó, and the steams La Bellaca and El Molino, that drain towards Apure River, Orinoco drainage.
result.population: There are no data available to estimate a population size.
result.habitat: This species inhabits creeks and streams of clear waters with rocky substrate and fast currents (Vari and Harold 2001).
result.threats: Approximately 44% of its distribution area has been converted for the settlement of towns, small cattle farms and coffee plantations, among others (Oliveira-Miranda et al. 2010). The Boconó River has been altered by the construction of a dam. Therefore, this species might be affected through habitat loss and at least one of its populations affected by barriers to its genetic flow.
result.conservationmeasures: Around 27% of its population occurs within protected areas such as Yacambú, Guaramacal and Sierra Nevada. However, most of its population occurs in areas that have been converted for agricultural use.
result.usetrade: It is unknown if this species is traded in the ornamental fish market.
